Message with 10 copies of "narrow" & "wide" glyphs in English & Hebrew

This is a message composition window of Thunderbird 60.4.0 on Devuan ASCII (~= Debian Stretch), using the Cinnamon window manager. The message contains lines with 10 copies each of "narrow" & "wide" glyphs in English & Hebrew: M vs l, ש vs. ו (SHIN vs VAV). You will notice the 10 l's are the same width as the 10 M's, but the 10 VAVs are much narrower than the 10 SHINs.

Fonts:

Latin Serif font: "Cambria" (yes, that's the name of the font face)
Latin Sans Serif font : "Calibri" (again, yes, that's the actual name of the font face)
Latin Monospace: "Consolas"

Hebrew Serif font: "serif" (yes, that's the name of the font face)
Hebrew Sans Serif font : "sans serif" (again, yes, that's the actual name of the font face)
Hebrew Monospace: "Liberation Mono"
